test_description: Validate complete service request lifecycle: Creation by User -> Routing to SC -> Assignment to Tech -> Resolution by Tech
business_risk: Critical - Core value proposition failure if broken
preconditions: Registered User with Product; Active Service Center covering User location; Active Technician in SC roster
test_steps: 1. User (Mobile): Create Service Request with photo. 2. System: Verify 'Requested' status and geo-routing to SC. 3. SC Admin (Web): Verify Request in dashboard, assign to Tech. 4. Tech (Mobile): Receive notification, update status to 'On The Way', then 'Resolved' with signature. 5. User (Mobile): Receive completion notification.
expected_result: Status transitions correctly (Requested -> Assigned -> In Progress -> Resolved); Data synced across all portals/apps in real-time.
test_data_needs: User with valid address; Service Center with defined Polygon; Technician account
tools_required: Playwright (Web), Detox (Mobile), MailHog (Email), Azure Service Bus Monitor
dependencies: Azure AD B2C; Azure Maps; Blob Storage; WebSocket Gateway
success_criteria: All status transitions successful; Latency < 2s for updates; No data loss
security_considerations: Verify RBAC enforcement at each step
performance_expectations: End-to-end flow completes without system lag

test_description: Verify Technician can complete job details while offline and sync occurs upon reconnection
business_risk: High - Data loss for field technicians
preconditions: Technician logged in; Jobs synced to local WatermelonDB
test_steps: 1. Enable Airplane Mode. 2. Open Assigned Job. 3. Enter notes, add parts, capture signature. 4. Tap 'Mark Resolved'. 5. Verify local 'Pending Sync' state. 6. Disable Airplane Mode. 7. Verify background sync execution.
expected_result: Data persists locally during outage; Auto-syncs without error on reconnect; Server reflects updates.
success_criteria: Zero data loss; Sync completes < 5s after reconnect
